title: UDL and Cognitive Load Theory-Based Music Literacy Education for Inclusive Music Classroom Design

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Consideration of diverse learner needs, including those with visual processing difficulties

learning_goals: Learners can design music score-reading activities by applying Universal Design for Learning (UDL) principles.
Learners can explain the interface principles of digital tools for composition education, considering Cognitive Load Theory.
Learners can develop one or more inclusive music education scenarios through small-group collaboration.

resources: UDL (Universal Design for Learning) Guidelines Document

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
